{{also|nöch}} ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/nɔx/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-noch.ogg}} * {{rhymes|nl|ɔx}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|nl|conjunction|head=noch...noch}} # [[neither]]...[[nor]] #: {{ux|nl|Als een ei te gaar gekookt wordt, verschijnt er soms een groenachtige ring rond de eidooier. Dit is het resultaat van ijzer- en zwavelsamenstellingen in het ei. Het kan ook vóórkomen wanneer er veel ijzer in het kokende water zit. De groene ring beïnvloedt '''noch''' smaak '''noch''' de samenstelling.http://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eierdooier|If an egg is cooked too well, there sometimes appears a greenish ring around the egg yolk. This is the result of compositions of iron and sulfur in the egg. It can also occur whenever there is much iron in the cooking water. The green ring influences '''neither''' the taste '''nor''' the composition.}} {{head|nl|conjunction}} # [[nor]] #: {{ux|nl|Officieel heeft de Europese Unie echter geen hoofdstad, '''noch''' de intentie er een vast te leggen.http://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brussel_als_Europese_hoofdstad|Officially, however, the European Union has no capital, '''nor''' the intention to declare one.}} ===References=== ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|noch}}, {{m|gmh|nog}}, from {{inh|de|goh|noh}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*nuh}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*nū-kʷe-}}. Cognate to {{cog|nl|nog}} and {{m|nl|noch}} (which are etymologically the same word). ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/nɔx/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/nɔ/|/no/}} {{a|chiefly southern Germany and Austria; also in the northern half in some positions, e.g. before ''{{l|de|nicht}}''}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-noch.ogg}} * {{audio|de|De-noch.ogg}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[still]], [[yet]] {{gloss|up to and including a given time}} #: {{ux|de|Du magst mich '''noch'''.|t=You '''still''' like me.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Ich bin '''noch''' nicht fertig.|t=I’m not ready '''yet'''.|inline=1}} # [[yet]], [[eventually]] {{gloss|at an unknown time in the future}} # [[additionally]], [[in addition]], [[besides]], [[else]]; {{ngd|more often expressed in English with}} [[another]], [[more]] #: {{ux|de|Da ist '''noch''' einer.|t=There’s '''another''' one.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Da sind '''noch''' welche.|t=There are some '''more'''.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Ich habe '''noch''' Schokolade im Auto.|t=I have some '''more''' chocolate in the car.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Weißt du '''noch''' was?|t=Can you think of anything '''else'''?|inline=1}} # (only) [[just]]; [[barely]] {{gloss|by a small margin}} # {{lb|de|with comparative}} [[even]] ====Derived terms==== {{top3}} * {{l|de|annoch}} * {{l|de|dennoch}} {{mid3}} * {{l|de|immer noch}} {{mid3}} * {{l|de|noch einmal}} {{bottom}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|de|conjunction|head=...noch}} # {{lb|de|following a negation|especially {{m|de|weder}}}} [[nor]]; {{ngd|function word introducing each except the first term or series, indicating none of them is true}} #: {{ux|de|Ich mag weder ihn, '''noch''' dich.|t=I like neither him '''nor''' you.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Er versteht es nicht, '''noch''' auch wird er es jemals verstehen.|He doesn’t understand it, '''nor''' will he ever understand it.}} ===See also=== * {{l|de|eben}} ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|dum|odt|noch||until now, still}}, from {{inh|dum|gem-pro|*nuh||still|lit=now too}}, from {{der|dum|ine-pro|*nu||now}} + {{m|ine-pro|*-kʷe-||and, also}}. ===Adverb=== {{dum-adv}} # [[still]], as before # [[later]], [[after all]] # [[yet]] [[again]] # [[additionally]] # {{lb|dum|with a comparative}} [[even]], [[yet]] ====Descendants==== * {{desc|nl|nog}} * {{desc|li|nag}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|dum|conjunction}} # [[neither]], [[nor]] ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|dum|nō}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|nl|noch}} * {{desc|li|nóch}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:VMNW|ID57052|I}} * {{R:VMNW|ID98382|II}} * {{R:MNW|32709|I}} * {{R:MNW|32710|II}} ---- ==Old Occitan== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|pro|la|noctem}}, accusative of {{m|la|nox}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|pro|/nɔtʃ/}} ===Noun=== {{pro-noun|f}} # [[night]] ====Descendants==== * {{desc|oc|nuèch}} ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Etymology 1=== Compare {{cog|de|noch}}, {{cog|nl|nog}}. ===Adverb=== {{head|pdc|adverb}} # [[yet]] # [[still]] ===Etymology 2=== Compare {{cog|de|nach}}, {{cog|nl|na}}. ===Preposition=== {{head|pdc|preposition}} # [[to]], [[towards]] # [[after]] ---- ==Saterland Frisian== ===Adverb=== {{head|stq|adverb}} # [[still]] # [[yet]] ---- ==West Frisian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|fy|ofs|noch}}, from {{inh|ofs|gem-pro|*nuh}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|fy|/nɔx/}} ===Adverb=== {{head|fy|adverb}} # [[still]] ====Further reading==== * {{R:WFT|67613|II}}
